text: Earl Wilbur Sutherland, Jr. (November 19, 1915 â€“ March 9, 1974) was an American pharmacologist and biochemist. He won the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 1971 for his discoveries concerning the mechanisms of the action of hormones. He was born in Burlingame, Kansas in 1915 and died in Miami, Florida, United States in 1974. ==References== Category:1915 births Category:1974 deaths Category:Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine winners Category:Scientists from Kansas Category:American biochemists Category:American Nobel Prize winners
title: Earl Wilbur Sutherland Jr.
